website_summaries.verdict: This full-on motorcycle security system adds security and convenience all in one.
pros: This kit utilizes a deafening 123-decibel anti-theft alarm that is triggered by remote or adjustable shock sensor
It also prevents hijacking with a power supply cutoff
Using similar methods, the package improves convenience by offering remote start, which comes in handy on cold days
Works with any motorcycle with 12-volt or 14-volt batteries
cons: The consistency of the alarm may be lacking as some users reported quiet sirens and false triggers

customer_reviews.title: Works but wonky.
customer_reviews.text: I installed this alarm on my Yamaha Roadliner and only hooked up the motion sensor part. It works most of the time but is temperamental. After I arm it it will emit around five 'chirps' a few minutes after it's armed. Then will do it again a few minutes later even when there is no wind or anything touching it. The sensitivity is sporadic. Sometimes it will just take a slight touch to set it off and other times you really have to knock it for it to go off. Honestly, I'm not really sure if I can recommend this alarm. It's too temperamental.
customer_reviews.author: Fletcher Arc

customer_reviews.title: fits taotao scooters
customer_reviews.text: bought for taotao cy50a scooter and later transferred to an atm50-a1 and it was a simple plug and play install. starts the atm50-a1 right up but had troubles with the cy50a though thats more likely because someone did their own wiring on that scooter than anything. alarm is super loud and adjustable for detection. first time using it a slight breeze was setting it off but read through the comments and figured out the adjustment and has been fine ever since. no soldering,crimping,splicing, nothing. plug it in and you're good to go
customer_reviews.author: Daedelus

customer_reviews.title: The alarm worked fine for a few days
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this alarm system for my Yamaha and did a basic install with only the positive and negative wires attached to the battery posts. The alarm worked fine for a few days, but started to immediately sound off after arming it. Was defective. I contacted the seller and they immediately sent me a replacement. The replacement system works fine now for the past few months and I also wired up the lights upon arming without issue. Not using the remote start function. Excellent customer service and a great deal for a basic alarm system.
customer_reviews.author: LukeIamYoFatha

customer_reviews.title: I applied a bit of epoxy and it has been holding up great. After some time of riding in mostly sunny ...
customer_reviews.text: This seller stands out among all others as respectful and accommodating. A pleasure to work with. If I need more parts or kits, I will be sure to first check their storefront first. The blank key would not work with my 2015 Suzuki (not enough length). I had the local hardware store copy my key and I cut it in half to fit the black fob. I applied a bit of epoxy and it has been holding up great. After some time of riding in mostly sunny warm weather (always covered in the rain) the control box produced a burnt smell and the alarm would not sound. The seller stands by their product and happily sent a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: Love this Alarm system!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent alarm system for the price. Very easy to install, if you have a Tao Tao Motor Scooter this is the system for you.. To install on a Tao Tao Scooter just look for the connector that has the loop plugged into it Unplug the loop from the connector and plug the Black box into that connector the plug the Red alarm into the Black box. Also install a 9 Volt Battery as a backup, there is also a connection for the battery. This will help not to drain your 12 volt main scooter battery.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: What a bargain!
customer_reviews.text: Great for price! Just wanted the basic alarm, so hooked it up to my battery (red to positive & black to negative), attached a 9 volt battery to the other red/black wires via connector and cut the rest (so I wouldn't be tempted to fiddle around with it any further). Set it to super sensitive (4 beeps) and it works like a charm. I have ZERO experience in this sort of thing but this was really easy. Better than spending $100+ having somebody install a system for you.
customer_reviews.author: Marlon

customer_reviews.title: Hail set this thing off!
customer_reviews.text: I installed this alarm the simplest way - black and red directly to the battery. I really don't have a use for remote start, as my bike needs a bit of throttle to get going, and I didn't want to tear into the wiring harness. I was pretty impressed when a hail storm (1/2" hailstones) started setting off the alarm. I'm not sure through what mechanism, but I guess it was from "motion"? Works as advertised, at a great price. Impressively loud and annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Mickler

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: Love how I am in control of sensitivity of alarm. There are 4 levels of sensitivity and I set mine to 3, just enough if anyone tries to get on it or move my bike. Didn't connect with remote start or whatever it comes with. The 2nd remote comes with dummy key that's probably for a car, so I am ordering a new set of motorcycle keys and will cut it to make it fit. 2nd remote can't adjust or set the alarm levels but just on and off.
customer_reviews.author: Choi family motorcycle Adventure

customer_reviews.title: Bad instructions, speaker and blinkers are easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: It works as advertised and really loud. Installed in new moped. Problem is instruction, pretty much meaningless. Mostly I had to guess and spend time look for similar one on YouTube. I gave up on fuel cut off and starter, just installed blinkers and speaker which were easy to install. Instead, got GPS tracker, heavy chain and cover.
customer_reviews.author: Applecola

customer_reviews.title: Motorcycle Alarm for Japanese Mini Truck
customer_reviews.text: Used this motorcycle alarm system for a Japanese mini truck. These alarms don't necessarily have to be used for motorcycles only. If you want something that responds to motion such as a lug wrench trying to pry you caps off, or your car door latch is lifted then this alarm is sensitive to respond. Additionally it is compact and comes with two remotes.
customer_reviews.author: Albert J.J. Mendiola

customer_reviews.title: Awesome alarm and best bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: I installed this into my 08 ninja zx6r. Its very loud and i was very satisfied with this alarm. I just plugged up the power wires and cut the rest that i didnt need. The alarm is very sensitive. For example. When I get back home from a ride, I set the alarm with the remote. Which has a very long range. I can be in the back yard while my bike is in the garage. And it still sets. When the motor is cooling down, cracking and looking from the metal shrinking back down. The alarm will go off from even that. And its just a quick beep. I love that!!!
customer_reviews.author: aries

customer_reviews.title: Overall pretty happy with the result
customer_reviews.text: Overall pretty happy with the result. I didn't expect this to be anything that special but it was worth the money seeing as if I do so much as put my finger on my bike the alarm will sound. It's good for deterring anyone who might be getting some ideas. One thing I was slightly disappointed about is the adhesive on the back of the siren isn't really up to par. I stuck it on and cleaned the surface first before sticking and it still fell off after a few days.
customer_reviews.author: Alec

customer_reviews.title: Well made and loud
customer_reviews.text: Installed this on my 2018 Honda 150 Scooter. This scooter is carried on the back of our class A coach. Being the bike is small I feel theft would be easy so I installed this alarm. Easy to install and works great. Super loud when it goes off. Nice deterant...lol
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It died in a few days
customer_reviews.text: Installed only the sensor, didn't hook up thre auto start or to flash the lights. It worked for a few days then just stopped. The remotes work. But no noise from the speaker. I put it inside the compartment under rear seat. The sensor was nice. It would give a warning if slightly bumped, then go off if continuously touched. Only thing was it wasn't really that loud. Couldn't hear it from inside the house.
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: GREAT WTF
customer_reviews.text: Yo... this thing is freaking amazing. For the price you can’t find anything as sensitive as this alarm. It actually starts my bike and is loud as hell. Love it. I halfto keep it on 2/5 sensitivity level because if it’s windy or rains hard it will go off. I looooovveee it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing alarm at a super low price!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing alarm! I bought this for my 2016 Honda CBR1000RR SP Repsol. I only hooked up the brain, siren and the positive & negative battery leads. I, like many others, did not want to deal with the engine kill or lights, I just wanted an alarm that was loud and would go off if someone tried to move my bike. All total, it took about 15 minutes to install this under the seat and get it working. It is very sensitive and VERY loud. The remotes are nice and I will be getting a key blank for the "switchblade" key fob. For the price, I do not think you can beat this alarm!
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Far exceeds my expectations.
customer_reviews.text: This product works exactly as advertised. It is a really good alarm system for a very small price. It took me only about 30 minutes to hook this up on my 2016 Yamaha FZ6R. I feel much better now parking this in the parking deck at work.I also like the fact that my bike is safer at home. I only hooked up the alarm but when I get time I will probably take advantage of the alarms other functions and benefits. You really cannot go wrong with this product for your bike. My wife while at home can use the extra remote as a panic alarm if necessary.
customer_reviews.author: J. Maranville

customer_reviews.title: Plug and Play!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit for Ice Bear Malibu, a.k.a. 2019 DAIX 1ST GENERATION scooter. 2 minutes to plug and mount the system. 2 minutes to test and set sensitivity. Plug was present, no wiring required. All lights blink with horn/siren. Engine starts remotely, but why anyone would use it??? kills running scooter remotely as well. AMAZING BUY and UPGRADE. Well worth the Money!!!
customer_reviews.author: C. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Alarm Works Well
customer_reviews.text: This product not only works Well, but it Was VERY easy to install the alarm feature. I simply went on YouTube and typed in the name of the alarm and I found videos showing how to install this on my moto. There are other features such as the keyless ignition and remote shut down, but I haven't installed these yet. Furthermore, I don't have any problems with the alarm being too sensitive. It's just right. It gives off a warning chirp if you touch the bike, and well it gives off a full alarm if you interfere with the bike again, subsequent to the warning chirp. All in all, good alarm for a great price
customer_reviews.author: Chris784

customer_reviews.title: Great added protection for your motorcycle
customer_reviews.text: In my case my scooter had a alarm that did not work anymore and this BlueFire Motorcycle alarm kit was plug and play,I have used it for a week and is working like a charm, everything function great it even turn on my scooter with the remote control. Thanks Blue Fire for this item! I would recommend this for adding security to there motorcycle.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Greatest out on the market
customer_reviews.text: The Bluefire Security System is fantastic. I recently purchased it for my 2013 yamaha r6. I installed the alarm alone without the other features in about an hour including removing the fairings and reinstalling them. I'd give it a 3 out of 5 in difficulty to install if u hardwire it. The loudness wise of this alarm will definitely let you know if anyone messes with your bike from a really good distance away. Which I feel is important incase you're in a store or at home. It's under 20 bucks,it's generally simple to install and I feel like I should of paid 80 dollars for it. All around I definitely recommend this product it's to good to pass up.
customer_reviews.author: Jason A.

customer_reviews.title: Good Product for TaoTao Roman 150cc scooter!
customer_reviews.text: I installed this on a 2014 Taotao Roman 150cc scooter. Plugged right into the wiring harness and worked with the exception of the remote start. Well the led taillight assembly went out and I replaced that with a non led assembly. The remote start works now. Turns out the taillight assembly is the source for the ground wire for the remote start to operate. So if you have a scooter with a led taillight,remote start might not work, but if you replace that it should be fine. Great product and great seller.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Currie

customer_reviews.title: Loud Siren and very easy to install. Dead after 1 year.
customer_reviews.text: Really Loud Chirps. I use it to deter people from touching my motorcycle and only need to wire Red and Black wires. Vibrations/impacts instantly trigger siren. Could be used inside car to scare off thieves. 08/15/2020, kicks bangs won’t set off the alarm. It is dead. Look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: amazon_rev6102

customer_reviews.title: Good for price
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is good for the price. I do not recommend hooking up remote start or engine shut down. Further there are no fuses and should be added as this is a safety hazard. The alarm is loud which is good but does not have attenuation for chirps which is moderately annoying. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Shanzon

customer_reviews.title: Great Alarm! But!(Always a but)
customer_reviews.text: This is a great alarm for $20. I have ordered 2 so far. Lost my keys on the first one. But it is very sensitive(NOT A BAD THING). I live in Hawaii and winds are strong so it goes off all the time. Mopeds are stolen all the time here and this is the best thing I have come across at a great price. Super easy to install as well!!!
customer_reviews.author: Hawai’i Girl

customer_reviews.title: Get what your pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Product seemed great at first but It randomly started going off while I was fueling my bike. And worse yet, the remote would not disarm it in this instance. Had to ride it back home with the alarm blaring so I could take the seat off and rip out this junk. Luckily it happened close to home. I do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy install for just alarm
customer_reviews.text: i didn't bother trying to make it push to start because of my wiring harness and i'm not experienced enough to know which wire is which and i didnt want to do unintentional damage but full install with all features is possible. Its not sensitive enough to go off if it rains which is great but if i forget its armed and i put my helmet on my seat it goes off. I really love it. Although in closed spaces or parking garages it's extremely loud but i dont mind, if anything i like people knowing its armed.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Works as intended for my scooter, even though I dont use remote-start option. Had the key cut at ACE with no problems. If they can't fit it to their machine, take out the 2 screws that hold the blank to the key fob and it will allow you take the blank out for them to cut it. The only downside is that when the alarm is tripped it only goes off for about 10-20 seconds, wish the time was a little longer even though the alarm is loud.
customer_reviews.author: RuSGaMeR

customer_reviews.title: Very good value. Ear damaging loud
customer_reviews.text: Great value! Very loud and easy to install. If you want, you can just have the alarm function and all you have to do is hook it up to your battery. I haven’t noticed any extra power draw. The horn is loud to the point that you should wear ear plugs while installing the system.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and effective.
customer_reviews.text: Only wired up the power for the alarm, did not wire in the starter or lights. Works well. Sensor is sensitive and alarm is sufficiently loud. One of the included remotes did not function, however I only need one. The remotes did not match. For the money there likely is not a better way to increase security.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the buy for any vehicle
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. Installed within 15 minutes, and has been working with no issues since. The alarm is really loud and I wish that you could somehow control that, but it is extremely effective at drawing attention. Remote start worked with minor idle adjustment.
customer_reviews.author: ERIC from DaPV144

customer_reviews.title: Actually a pretty good little system
customer_reviews.text: Actually a pretty good little system , extremely loud definitely lets people know something is going on, installed it in a cargo trailer connected to a jumper box until i bought a small solar charger and a deep cycle battery and it works very well , haven't had any issues with false alarms but if you tap any part of the trailer the system wakes the neighbors lol.
customer_reviews.author: Gideon

customer_reviews.title: Awesome alarm system if you just want the alarm function
customer_reviews.text: Awesome alarm system if you just want the alarm function. Powered by a 9 volt battery. Will see if it works with the battery of my motorcycle. If you want the alarm function only, just connect the battery, connect the speaker alarm connection, locate a place to mount it on the bike...and there you have it...
customer_reviews.author: CruzP

customer_reviews.title: Loud and pretty simple....
customer_reviews.text: Loud and pretty simple to install with only the motion alarm active. I installed this in my garage and set off the alarm to test it and man was I to close to it. Thing is loud. I can hear it from inside my house while its in the garage with a yard between the buildings.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar M.

customer_reviews.title: install is pretty simple. i think it has an option to ...
customer_reviews.text: install is pretty simple. i think it has an option to attach to a seperate 9v battery because mine came with a connection for it. but i just connected it to my bikes battery. its not overly sensitive and is pretty loud (depending on position also). Both clickers work, now i just have to install my key to the key fob. I wanted an alarm that was straight to the point. I did not need a two way because its not practical. My bike is chained right out my window. And if i do go to a mall for example, the range on most two ways will be instantly useless. so great product! simple is better.
customer_reviews.author: JohnMR

customer_reviews.title: Simple and let's me know about my bike.
customer_reviews.text: Very simple to install. I wanted something to let me know about my bike. It does the job. My led as hooked into the turn signals. To the bike lights up crazy for the alarm. For the price. Great.
customer_reviews.author: T - M A N

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, easy, great price.
customer_reviews.text: Love this alarm. Got it installed fairly quickly. I only ran the basic alarm by finding a good spot for the components and running the red wire to the battery. Simple as that! I will probably add the light feature later on. From what I've read, using auto-start/kill isn't a good idea for theft/safety reasons. Can't beat the price and it offers me just the amount of theft protection I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Stop working
customer_reviews.text: Broke or stopped working after a week. I had it on a 9v battery. Tried returning it but window to return was too small. I told my scooter group it was a nice buy now I have to tell them not to get it.
customer_reviews.author: MzClaves

customer_reviews.title: This thing cannot possible be a motorcycle alarm, you ...
customer_reviews.text: I want to first say i received great customer service after receiving this product. The first one did not work and I opted to return it. Within hours i was contact by the customer service. They sent me a brand new one without needing to return the old one. They got the new one to me expedited shipping. The product works great and as advertised. Even not on the 4 sensitive this is very sensitive. 2 wire hook up makes install and set up very east. Great customer service and a great product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Barrick

customer_reviews.title: Works well, pretty sensitive.
customer_reviews.text: Great price, pretty sensitive. My dog barks near the bike and the alarm goes off. Install, I just use the alarm function without the auto start so i just connected the red and black wires to my battery. Easy install.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Comes with better instructions.
customer_reviews.text: Works great, just goes off anytime. I think maybe it's set to sensitive and I don't know how to change setting.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service!
customer_reviews.text: Loud but not as sensitive as I'd have liked, even on max sensitivity. And then it feels like it's not consistently sensitive. Update: they got in touch with me and immediately sent me a replacement alarm. Will update once I've installed it. But they get 5 stars from me for customer service
customer_reviews.author: Stephen S.

customer_reviews.title: The manual is not that helpful but works as advertise ...
customer_reviews.text: The manual is not that helpful but works as advertise after a few experiments. Make sure you are familiar with the motorcycle wiring capabilities so you can utilize the full function of this security system. Only thing i noticed is that its too sensitive even just for a big truck passing by.
customer_reviews.author: Francis

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price, but no longevity.
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd time I've bought this alarm. Installed in the winter while bike was parked. After finally taking it on a trip, the speaker was super quiet. Next trip I went on it stopped working completely.
customer_reviews.author: chewy81

customer_reviews.title: Control unit fits great under the seat and horn mounts good next to ...
customer_reviews.text: Installed this alarm on my Can Am Outlander Max XT 1000. Control unit fits great under the seat and horn mounts good next to the air box lid. Unit works great, only problem I am having is the unit is so sensitive it gives the warning beeps a few times as the ATV cools off and only seems to happen in the cool mornings. I'm sure its due to the hot metal under the seat popping as it cools.
customer_reviews.author: Muddy

customer_reviews.title: Packaging
customer_reviews.text: Am VERY pleased so far. I bought this unit for my sons motorcycle as a Christmas Gift. The only thing I didn't really care for was that the item arrived in a plastic bag. You know younger people,, package looks cool, they're excited! Other than that, so far I am pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Lokey

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and works well
customer_reviews.text: For the price you just cant beat it. I did only hook up the alarm, but it works great on default settings. I forgot the first time I went out and set my helmet on my seat and it gave a warning immediately. 9 volt battery back up is nice too. If your looking for some inexpensive protection dont hesitate. This is the best one IMO
customer_reviews.author: Will H

customer_reviews.title: NOT LOUD ENOUGH! My motorcycle was stolen and i didn't hear the alarm at all. Don't make the same mistake that i did...
customer_reviews.text: NOT LOUD ENOUGH! - I had installed this is my band new 2016 Kawasaki Ninja ZX10R Motorcycle a few days after i got it. The motorcycle was stolen from outside of my house while i was home, and awake! I just simply did not hear the alarm and neither did my neighbors. PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE SPEND THE EXTRA MONEY ON A NICE ALARM SYSTEM to avoid having to spend $20,000 on a motorcycle that you no longer own because it was stolen!
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: which is great because that’s what i bought it for
customer_reviews.text: Installation was a breeze. However, I only installed the alarm portion. Activating the alarm is sensitive, which is great because that’s what i bought it for. Note: you’ll need to buy some spades and heat shrink if you want a clean installation.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Valencia

customer_reviews.title: Random alarms
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for the first few weeks. Now it randomly will go off. Even on setting 1 it will go off after a few mins of arming it.
customer_reviews.author: Brad lamb

customer_reviews.title: Plug and play, but the key is wrong.
customer_reviews.text: Plugged right into the connector and worked right away. Installed on a 2019 Taotao Pilot. Very sensitive motion detection, good remote start sensitivity (just leave the kill switch on the run position, no keys needed). my one complaint is that the key blank that comes with it is cut opposite of they key I have, so I will have to cut a custom blank if I want the flip key in the Fob.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: best deal I could find and works great
customer_reviews.text: For the price, best deal I could find and works great. Just have to know that the fobs provided are not the same looking, one is ridiculous as it has 3 types of patterns going on, the other is really nice expect it's too small to house any of the 3 motorcycle keys we have but I feel like I shouldn't deduct for that.
customer_reviews.author: John S

customer_reviews.title: It will work
customer_reviews.text: Awsome work's as it's supposed to just plug and play put on a Chinese scooter
customer_reviews.author: herminio santana

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working 2 months after install.
customer_reviews.text: Installed this on a 2018 honda grom. Worked great for the first month, then It would ARM like its working but moving the bike and riding the bike would not set the alarm off. Double checked the connections and install, everything was like day 1 except the functionality of the alarm ceased. You get what you pay for....
customer_reviews.author: Whydeydodat

customer_reviews.title: Alarm randomly goes off now
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for the first half a year, but then started randomly going off if not at a significant angle. Battery usage is not bad, so it has that going for it, and the alarm has a good volume.
customer_reviews.author: A Random Guy

customer_reviews.title: It fought my bike in fire after the Male to female clips melted together
customer_reviews.text: Hooked up the Male to female clips and a day later all I could smell was electrical fire smell. The alarm caught on fire and my motorcycle let not but a few moments after that!! I'm at a loss cause what do I say your product couggt my bike on fire. All they would say is prove it was my product
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install. You can adjust the sensitivity of the sensor so it doesn't go off every time the wind blows. Very happy because it goes off if I try to open my saddlebags while the alarm is activated. Great deal for the price, super fast shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Jake&Kat

customer_reviews.title: Nice and easy.
customer_reviews.text: Easy install. Works fine. Only did flashers and alarm though. Not messing with ignition stuff. Simply splice flashers into rear turn signal, run pos and neg to battery, mount brain near frame , mount speaker in a fender that can't be accessed from outside. Done.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. For 18 or 19 bucks
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. For 18 or 19 bucks, it does as advertised. Now if i could remember that its armed and quit going up and just jumping on, scaring the crap out of myself...... id be all good.
customer_reviews.author: Rocket Rider

customer_reviews.title: .thanks!
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd one I've recorded aaasthe 1st one was defective. It was very quiet but worked. Now, this 2nd one is very loud, but the touch sensitivity does not work! I gave up on it not knowing what to do, stop i figured i could at least writean honest review. I'd love to try another one. Because they are ALMOST super nice... If i could just get one that works!
customer_reviews.author: tom toohey

customer_reviews.title: Totally Died after only one month
customer_reviews.text: It only worked for a month then its functions go wrong very low sound and very bad sensor sometimes alarm without touching the bike or anything happen close to it ... very bad product don’t recommended for any one. It will work only for a month then you will put it in trash
customer_reviews.author: Christine Samir

customer_reviews.title: it is what it is
customer_reviews.text: dMn remote with key broke immediately fell apart. red one is good though. Chinese stuff I guess :/ It Is pretty straightforward if you have the manual to your bike + have skills . . . lol jk doesnt take much
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Easy install and LOUD!
customer_reviews.text: A great and easy install. Ive had it installed for four days so far. The alarm has operated as it should without any hitches. It is extremely loud and very sensitive. Big pluses in my book. The remotes seems to have very adequate range. I like that it comes with two remotes. The black remote with flip up key is interesting in that you can remove the key they sent with it via a small screw and put in your own cut blank with a little bit of diy. I would recommend this product to anyone looking to make their motorcycle harder to steal.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Irwin

customer_reviews.title: Works well for what it’s meant to do
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t hook up all the features I’ve done the alarm and with the lights. It works nicely but to set it off you really have to give the bike a nice bump for the alarm to sound or give a warning idk if its because of where I have the sensor set up ,“in the tail section”, but that’s how it works for me.
customer_reviews.author: Brix

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what is says.... Been ...
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what is says.... Been fitted now for over a month and has been subjected to riding for 2hours in quite a serious storm. I have it connected to the bike battery not the 9V slave. Only use it when I am leaving my bike for long periods in unknow places.
customer_reviews.author: Mr H J Murray

customer_reviews.title: Excellent price
customer_reviews.text: A+ seller! Item received as advertised! Great product for a great price! Thank you for a pleasant transaction!
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit all motorcycles!
customer_reviews.text: I took a gamble on this product hoping it would be compatible with my Ducati. This product states it fits with any 12/24 volt motorcycle. Please consider doing more thorough research before purchasing this system because many modern motorcycles require a system that doesn't affect the ECU if you mess around with any wiring
customer_reviews.author: Ryanel Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Good utv alarm
customer_reviews.text: Works great.. I installed it easily on my Yamaha rhino and it’s perfect super loud. We will see how long it lasts
customer_reviews.author: LiL MaMa

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and works great!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second unit I have purchased for a Harley Davidson Motorcycle. I only use the motion part and is a very easy 2 wire connection, the motion sensor works very well as it will sound when bumped by a person or car door. I do not use the battery backup. I have left the bike parked for up to 2 weeks and never had a battery drain issue. Range on the remote is good. Would recommend this alarm to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Mike B

customer_reviews.title: Excellent protection for your Scoot
customer_reviews.text: Can't beat this for the dollar. Excellent protection for your Scoot. Easy install. I would recommend you add an on and off switch for when it's not being Armed as you will notice it drains your battery.
customer_reviews.author: JEFFREY

customer_reviews.title: Pretty loud
customer_reviews.text: Ok so far it is loud and it works. I havent fully connected it like to the battery since I had to take the battery out for the winter, but i did leave the alarm inside the bike and once the seat is touched it goes off. Ill def connect it to the battery in the spring time and update my review
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my 2017 R6. Very easy to install. If you’re going straight to the battery, you’ll need good quality ring electrical wire connectors.
customer_reviews.author: Charito

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: It's a good alarm just make sure you lock the alarm so that it does not start if you have hit the start button and with the key off it will still start so you have to watch that you could lock the system up and the engine could still start
customer_reviews.author: tony lawson

customer_reviews.title: Device goes off at random
customer_reviews.text: The device goes off at random a drop of rain a piece of snow Weis Markets the wind will set this device off and run your battery dead I continuously goes off Non-Stop it doesn't cut off after time
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better instructions on product
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product twice and it didn’t work on my scooter I followed wiring directions it didn’t work the time I ordered it kept blowing fuses . So return them both I will not ordered again I will find another type alarm from elsewhere.not worth the cost and time
customer_reviews.author: carrel

customer_reviews.title: ALARM HAS STOPPED WORKING CHIRPING IS LOW IN SOUND AND WILL NOT RESPOND WITH REMOTE
customer_reviews.text: Please help, I've purchased this alarm system for my motorcycle based on reviews of this product. It has worked just fine up until a couple days ago. The alarm siren sound is very low in sound (quiet) & the key fobs do not work to engage or disengage. I just had to manually disconnect it from my battery this morning. My email is jerryhernacki@yahoo.com
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for a month , nice and loud seamed like a good buy. Now you can barely hear it. I checked all connections and wires , can't get it to work. Get what you pay for. Would like to get some of my money back or a replacement. Since this review Bluefire was nice enought to send a replacement and quick to, the company is 5 star. I just haven't had the time to install the new one.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Nice alarm
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice alarm system for a great price. I'm glad I didn't spend $100 on a designer system. This does just what I need it to and takes minutes to install. I highly recommended its really worth it if you care about your bike.
customer_reviews.author: zhuoran zhang

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to install!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to install! Just used the alarm part of the package. Works great! Very loud and will get anyone's attention!
customer_reviews.author: HAPPYSTAN

customer_reviews.title: Love the product
customer_reviews.text: Love the product, the install is pretty easy and would work on pretty much any motorcycle. Hardest part for me was removing the fairing. I have a 2016 Kawasaki 636. It is very loud and having the remote is awesone
customer_reviews.author: TacoBellBatman

customer_reviews.title: Good Purchase 5Stars
customer_reviews.text: I will give this product 5 stars it does what it says and I feel like my 2,500 dollar scooter is secure at night .Good Purchase. Yes the lights blink on when it goes off also.
customer_reviews.author: geralddavis

customer_reviews.title: Loud
customer_reviews.text: Small easy to hide simple hook up, nice remote.., satisfied
customer_reviews.author: anthony

customer_reviews.title: Alarm works great!
customer_reviews.text: This was a simple installation as my 2016 BMS Heritage 150 was prewired from the factory for an alarm. The Bluefire alarm matched an existing electrical connector that had a jumper. The wiring colors did not match exactly, but I took a chance, unplugged the jumper connector and plugged the alarm connector in. Every function worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: ed douglas

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price and louder than I imagined
customer_reviews.text: Just like most of the other reviews skeptical about price $17 well works well I had a gorilla alarm on previous bike and that was over $100, can't say it's comparable but you do get a decent alarm for $17. I wired mine standalone just power none of the splicing into indicator lights and so on.
customer_reviews.author: Mik

customer_reviews.title: best 15$ spent for an alarm
customer_reviews.text: almost went deaf testing it, didn't need to adjust sensitivity, fit right next to battery under the seat perfectly without adhesive. 13 zx10r (best spot to put it) haven't tested it against rain or time yet.
customer_reviews.author: brighton stoll

customer_reviews.title: Great so far...
customer_reviews.text: Haven't installed yet - just opened the package. Parts look nice and COMPACT. A little short on instructions, but we'll have fun figuring it out. Might annoy the neighbors a few times getting the alarms set just right!
customer_reviews.author: T J Wizard

customer_reviews.title: Great mod.
customer_reviews.text: Easily the best $19 I have spent all year. Truly plug and play for a scooter, it's almost like the scooter is begging you to buy this. Come on, make your scooter happy.
customer_reviews.author: Kachi's Kid

customer_reviews.title: A few hiccups....But they made good on it!
customer_reviews.text: raised to 5 stars: received a defective alarm, and did not even know it until the asked me (YES, they e-mailed me) if i had any issues. They just sent out a new one and it will be here in a few days. the issue i had was the alarm would not sound off for more than 5 seconds, everything else worked great! VERY LOUD and sensitive!! Just the great customer service alone would make me do business with this seller again!
customer_reviews.author: Keith C.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to hook up does what it's supposed to.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to hook up on my 09 ninja 250. Everything works well. Not as loud as I expected after reading some reviews on here, but loud enough. Next time around I may buy one with a blinking light just as an extra deterrent.
customer_reviews.author: Dale H

customer_reviews.title: It is pretty sensitive, bumping into the bike will definitely set ...
customer_reviews.text: It is very loud and install was a snap, literally. I did the minimum install which only takes the positive and negative wires and connects them to the battery. Maybe sometime down the road i'll integrate the turn signals. It is pretty sensitive, bumping into the bike will definitely set it off/ I use this for one of my layers of security.
customer_reviews.author: Bojan B.

customer_reviews.title: Just a great alarm
customer_reviews.text: Working as Expected. No battery drain so far. The manual is no good at all have to figure out how to manage some of the cables. The only function that I'm not using is to autostart. Everything else is working as Expected. Very good product, very recommended
customer_reviews.author: Michael Zelaya

customer_reviews.title: Great alarm. It's what I was expecting.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, did it myself and works just perfect. I didn't install the flashing lights or the cutting power cause my bike already have it. It's very loud and sensitive. Awesome for the money. Greatly recommended!!
customer_reviews.author: Hector Macin

customer_reviews.title: Easy operation
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install.alarm works and is fairly loud.plug and play for taotao scooter.
customer_reviews.author: Peter a

customer_reviews.title: sharp noise not loud
customer_reviews.text: Emits sharp sound but enough loud to be noticed by neighbors .
customer_reviews.author: weldhaj

customer_reviews.title: Cheap!
customer_reviews.text: quality is so cheap. The picture looks far better than what you will get.
customer_reviews.author: jscny

customer_reviews.title: Loud
customer_reviews.text: Loud and work as it say it does cheat but does the same as the other one
customer_reviews.author: chad

customer_reviews.title: Works good.
customer_reviews.text: Only use the alarm but it works good and loud I also put a fuse on the + side for safety.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: Very loud and sensitive to movement. Good price and does what I need it to do.
customer_reviews.author: kv

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: My Son bought this for his new boat. Just a nudge set it off! Easy install. Works great & saved money too!
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Lee Boehl

customer_reviews.title: Simple, Functional, INEXPENSIVE
customer_reviews.text: Installed the alarm portion only. Took about 30 minutes. Severed all the unused wires. Removed the connectors and soldered the wires. Love the integrated key. Worked seamlessly and..... IT IS LOUD!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: BlueFire Motorcycle Security Kit Alarm System Anti-Hijacking Cutting Off Remote Engine Start Arming Disarming
feature_bullets: Work with any motorcycle with 12 Volt batteries
This electronic Anti-theft Alarm with remote controller can let your motorbike keep away from thieves
Automatic remote engine start; Adjustable Shock Sensor
Remote Arming/Disarming (Flashing lights warning/125db powerful siren warning)
Emergency alarm: Anti-Hijacking by Cutting off Power Supply
